snippet: The New Yorker essayist Roger Angell is the first nonmember of the Baseball Writers’ Association of America to receive the J. G. Taylor Spink Award.
abstract: Roger Angell, whose graceful prose has made him baseball’s foremost essayist for more than half a century, will be honored at the Hall of Fame next summer as the winner of the J G Taylor Spink Award; he is the first winner not to be a member of the Baseball Writers’ Association of America.
lead_paragraph: The New Yorker essayist Roger Angell is the first nonmember of the Baseball Writers’ Association of America to receive the J. G. Taylor Spink Award.

headline.main: Angell to Be Honored at Hall of Fame
headline.print_headline: Angell to Be Honored at Hall
